name.text: Evaluating the rational functions at the given point

questiontext.text:
Consider the function on the interval \( {@-bb/aa@} < x < {@cc@} \) given by,

\( h(x)={@Exp4@} \)


(a) Find \(a\) such that \(h(a)=0\)

\(a=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

[[feedback:prt1]]


(b) Find \(b\) such that \(h^{-1}(b)={@ff@}\)

\(b=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]]

[[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

(a) We want to solve the equation,

\({@Exp4@}=0\)

This is true if the numerator is equal to \(0\) and the denominator is non-zero. First we solve the linear equation given by the numerator,

\({@Exp1@}=0\)

\({@dd*x@}={@-ee@}\)

\(x={@-ee/dd@}\)

Now we check that the denominator is non-zero at this point,

{@simp:false;@}

\(\begin{align*} {@line1@} &= {@line2@} \\ &= {@line3@} \\ & \neq 0 \end{align*}\)

{@simp:true;@}

So, we may take \(a = {@-ee/dd@}\)


(b) You might have been tempted to find the inverse of \(h(x)\) and then solve \(h^{-1}(b)={@ff@}\).
However, it is much easier to notice that if \(h^{-1}(b)={@ff@}\) then \(b = h({@ff@})\)
So, we need only to substitute {@ff@} into \(h(x)\).

\(h(x) = {@Exp4@}\)

\( h({@ff@}) = \frac{{@dd@} \cdot {@ff@} + {@ee@}}{{@aa@} \cdot {@ff@}^2 {@S1(-aa*cc+bb)@} \cdot {@ff@} - {@cc*bb@}} = {@(dd*ff + ee) / (aa*ff^2 + (-aa*cc+bb)*ff - cc*bb)@} \)

So, we have \(b={@Tans2@}\)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: You have solved the denominator equal to 0. This would not find when \(h(x)=0\) but rather when the function was not defined (because you cannot divide by 0.
You have solved the denominator equal to 0. This would not find when \(h(x)=0\) but rather when the function was not defined (because you cannot divide by 0).
I think you have solved the numerator equal to the denominator. Perhaps you thought it was to be equal to 1 and not 0?
I think you have solved the numerator equal to the denominator. Perhaps you thought it was to be equal to 1 and not 0?
I think you have made a mistake with the sign

falsefeedback.text: You must have made a mistake somewhere.
I think you have made a mistake somewhere.
